entry.title: Re: Scheduling agreements for component suppliers documen...
entry.content:
Hello @former_member726943 

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Logistics for Brazil, the Forecast Delivery Schedule (FDS) is the controlling element for scheduling agreements. The system uses the forecast quantities as the basis for:

  • Determining the order quantity in the scheduling agreement item, and
  • Correct calculation of conditions and net values.

The JIT Delivery Schedule (JIT DSch) is solely regarded as a call-off against the forecast. It offers short-term delivery dates and quantities; however, it does not influence order quantity or pricing independently. Consequently, if the Forecast Delivery Schedule is not properly maintained, the order quantity at the item level will remain at 0, and the conditions tab will not compute accurately, even if JIT schedules are present.

What to do in the Cloud Brazil localisation:

  • Always maintain the Forecast Delivery Schedule either:
    • Manually using the Fiori app “Manage Scheduling Agreements”, or
    • By receiving the electronic forecast delivery schedule (for example, via DELFOR message from the customer).
  • Use JIT schedules only for detailed short-term releases.
  • This setup is required by SAP’s Brazil localization design for SD-SLS-OA Scheduling Agreements.

SAP Documentation reference

  • SAP Help Portal – SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Brazil – Scheduling Agreements (SD-SLS-OA)
  • Brazil legal requirment -SAP HELP
  •  Forecast and delivery schedules in scheduling agreements

It's important to always keep the Forecast Delivery Schedule up to date, whether through the Fiori app or electronic integration. Without doing so, the order quantity and condition calculations won't work properly, even if a JIT schedule is in place.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Q3 2025 Release
entry.content:
SAP has officially rolled out its Q3 2025 release for SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and it brings exciting new features that make working with data easier and faster.

  • Home Page Renewal: Personalized Productivity : The SAC home page has been completely redesigned to enhance user experience and productivity. New interface makes it easier than ever to navigate SAC and stay focused on what matters most. Key highlights include:
    • Customizable layout tailored to individual workflows
    • Quick access to: 
      • JustAsk (natural language query assistant)
      • Guided learning paths
      • Recent and featured files
      • Calendar highlights
  • AI-Assisted Features: AI deeply into SAC with several new capabilities:
    • Advanced Formula Generation -
      • Use natural language comments to generate complex formulas.
      • Automatically create descriptions for existing scripts.
      • Ideal for data actions and planning models.
    • AI-Assisted Commenting -
      • Summarize, translate, and rephrase comments in tables / story.
    • Chart Summary for PowerPoint -
      • Generate presentation-ready summaries of charts.
      • Save time and improve communication of insights.
    • Natural Language Calculations -
      • Define calculations in Data Analyzer using plain language.
  • Data Analyzer Enhancements: The Data Analyzer now supports:
    • Scheduling of reports
    • Color highlighting for better readability
    • Hyperlink integration into stories
    • New calculation options for deeper analysis
  • Better modeling Tools : Modeling in SAC is now more powerful and secure as -
    • New aggregation exception types for advanced logic
    • Conditional validation to ensure data quality
    • Data security-based display: restrict data visibility based on user roles.
  • Story building made easier:
    • New table builder experience with undo/redo
    • Arrow indicators to visually represent positive/negative values
    • Performance recommendations tab to optimize story performance.
  • System Administration Updates: 
    • SAP BTP cockpit integration for planning data storage.
    • Enhanced SSO (Single Sign-On) for easier access across SAP products

entry.title: Re: Where can I found the Customer - extend existing reco...
entry.content:
Hello @Ingrid_at_Applium 

The migration object “Customer – extend existing record by multiple addresses” is not available in the Migrate Your Data app.

This object relies on the business function BPCUSTOMER_MULTIPLE_ADDRESSES2 (Multiple Address Handling for Customer Master Data). You can activate this function in on-premise or private cloud environments, but it’s not accessible in Public Cloud, where business functions are not customer-activated.

That’s why you might not see this migration object in your project, even if it's mentioned in some help portal documentation.

Recommended approach in Public Cloud:

  • Use the delivered migration objects (Customer, Customer – Extend by Company Code, Customer – Extend by Sales Area) for the initial load.
  • Maintain additional addresses afterwards via the Manage Business Partner Master Data Fiori app or automate updates via OData APIs.

In S4 Public Cloud, the multiple-address migration object isn’t delivered, so additional addresses must be handled after migration through apps or APIs.

SAP Reference documentation

  • Central Note: Multiple Address Handling in SD Documents Using SAP Business Partner
  • SAP Help Portal – Migration Objects for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Flexible Stock Selection for Delivery – Q Stock or Un...
entry.content:
Hello @Haily 

It is correct for Strategy Group E2 to enforce a link to a WBS element, causing MRP and ATP to always source from project stock (Q stock) instead of unrestricted stock.

However, it’s important to clarify that stock determination (OMSL/OBBC) cannot be used to switch between project stock and unrestricted stock. Stock determination only applies across categories such as unrestricted, quality inspection, and blocked stock, but project stock is managed as special stock and is excluded from this logic.

If the business needs flexibility to ship the same material either from project stock or from unrestricted stock, this must be managed during sales order creation rather than at delivery. The standard method is to use different requirement types or sales order types.:

  • Project-related orders (linked to WBS) will consume Q stock.
  • Standard orders (no WBS) will consume unrestricted stock.

This approach allows the same material to be shipped from either stock type, with the decision made during order creation rather than at delivery.

With kind regards

Chuma

GenAI Assist content. SAP Document References:

  • SAP Help Portal – Project Stock in Sales and Distribution
  • Physical Inventory Process-SAP Help

entry.title: Re: 請問有API可以讓外部系統查詢[自動科目決定]嗎?
entry.content:
Hello @Fang 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, there are no traditional SAP GUI transaction codes tcodes. All activities are conducted using Fiori apps, each identified by an App ID.

There are no tcodes when transitioning from ECC or S/4HANA on-premise, so SAP offers cross-references in the Fiori Apps Reference Library. This simplifies the process of matching familiar tcodes to their Fiori counterparts.

A few examples from Finance:

  • FB50 (Post G/L Document) → Post Journal Entries -App ID F0718
  • FB03 (Display Document) → Display Journal Entries-App ID F7697
  • F110 (Automatic Payments) → Manage Automatic Payments -APP ID F0770
  • OBYC (MM Account Determination) → done via Manage Your Solution → Configure Your Solution using SSCUIs

For configuration activities like OBYC, there isn’t a direct tcodes replacement; instead, it’s handled in guided configuration steps (SSCUI).

No codes are in Public Cloud; instead, there are Fiori apps and SSCUIs, with mapping references available to bridge the gap.

Hope it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: F2582 Team Utilization and Workers Management Hierarchy
entry.content:
Hello @RogerEarle 

Thank you for the question

The Current system Behaviour

  • The Team Utilisation app (F2582) shows only direct reports for each manager.
  • It relies on data from the Manage Workforce app (F0770).
  • If a worker, Carlos Sainz, reports to a manager, Janice Short, who in turn reports to a higher manager, David Jones, only Janice appears as David’s direct report. Carlos does not show up for David, only for Janice.
  • Indirect relationships are not automatically displayed. This is how the app is designed and is not a configurable setting.

The course of the error

The utilization app does not assess multiple levels of reporting hierarchy. This is the current standard behaviour, not a configuration issue.

Possible solution

Change Reporting Structure

    • Assign indirect workers like Carlos directly to higher-level managers like David in the workforce hierarchy.
    • This allows David to see and manage Carlos

Hope it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Error message while confirming a repair order in SAP...
entry.content:
Hello @belaiche 

Error item 10: A record transferred on 02/28/2025 lacks a personnel number, indicating that the user confirming the repair order is not associated with an employee record containing a valid personnel number. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, confirmations for service or repair orders always require this employee association.

Please check the following;

Maintain Employee Master Data

    • Go to the Manage Workforce or Maintain Employees app.
    • Make sure the person performing the confirmation exists as an employee and has a valid personnel number.

Assign Business User to Employee

    • In the same app, confirm that the Business User ID is assigned to the employee record.
    • Without this link, the system cannot derive the personnel number during order confirmation.

Organizational Assignment

    • Make sure the employee is assigned to the correct organisational unit, for example, the service org or plant relevant to the repair order.

If you find that the employee record is missing, go ahead and create it. If you notice that it exists but is missing some details, such as the business user link, simply update the record to fill in the gaps. This way, everything stays current and complete.

Once the business user is properly linked to an employee with a personnel number, the repair order confirmation should work without errors.

Hope it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

 

GenAI Assisted Content

SAP Document references

  • SAP Help – Manage Workforce
  • KBA 2646803 - How to Maintain Workforce Person Data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Re: Flexible Stock Selection for Delivery – Q Stock or Unrestricted Stock
entry.content: That’s a really good question 👍 It sounds like your setup is currently forcing everything into project stock once you use the WBS link, which limits flexibility. In many cases, whether you can ship from Q stock or unrestricted stock comes down to how the sales order is structured and the storage location assignment. You may want to look into separating the process with different storage locations or using availability check rules that distinguish between Q and unrestricted stock. It might also be worth asking your functional consultant if a user exit or configuration tweak could allow the system to let you pick at delivery time instead of forcing one path. This is definitely a scenario that pops up when businesses need both options for the same material. Would you like me to suggest some possible SAP config paths that others have used for similar setups?

entry.title: Re: Manufacturer in Material Master
entry.content:
Hello @Dinesh_158 

Yes, you can use the Manufacturer field in the material master to record the actual manufacturer or brand, even if you are purchasing the material through a dealer. This field is separate from the supplier/vendor master and is meant for capturing the real manufacturer information.

If you need to store a unique brand name distinct from the manufacturer and report on it, the recommended approach in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is to use Classification with a custom characteristic for Brand, or you can create a custom field via In-App Extensibility and expose it in reporting through a custom CDS view 

You can check the SAP Help documentation for Material Master in S/4HANA Cloud here:
SAP Help – Material Master Data

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to connect SAP Planon with S4HANA Public cloud wi...
entry.content:
Hello @897654208074 

You can connect Planon with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition via SAP Master Data Integration (MDI) on SAP BTP. Planon offers the REM4SAP app, which synchronises master data like business partners, cost centres, and rentable units. with S/4HANA Cloud using the One Domain Model.

Follow steps below.

Activate MDI service in SAP BTP.

Configure the Planon REM4SAP app (system URL, client ID, token).

Register S/4HANA Cloud in MDI and map the master data objects.

Use standard Planon-to-SAP mappings; transactional data flows use iFlows, not MDI.

SAP Document References

  • SAP Help – Integration with Planon Real Estate Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Planon REM4SAP Documentation

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma
